msDesc.head: A Porphyry, Aristotle, Cicero, with commentaries of Boethius, Germany (Mainz?), 11th century; B John of Hildesheim, Speculum fons vitae, Germany, 14th century

physDesc.p: Composite: two manuscripts (fols. 1–166 || fols. 167–176) probably together at Eberbach Abbey by at least 1502.

history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian abbey (?): the whole volume probably identifiable as R 23 in the catalogue of 1502 ('Textus porphirii cum commento Item quidem tractatus marci T Item libellus qui dicitur fons vite Initium Cum sit ne-'; N. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher (1998), 251, without reference to this manuscript).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description by Matthew Holford (Sept. 2020). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 24 Quarto Catalogue, col. 25
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2, part 1, p. 49

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, I (1966), no. 30 (part A), pl. IV

msItem.author: Porphyry
msItem.title: Isagoge
msItem.note: (tr. Boethius)
msItem.incipit: Cum sit necessarium crisarori

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In Isagogen Porphyrii Commentorum editio prima
msItem.rubric: Anicii Manlii Severini Boetii in Porphyrii Ysagogen a Mario Victorino translatas editionis prime liber primus incipit
msItem.incipit: Hiemantis anni tempore
msItem.note: Bk. i ends fol. 9vb, followed by art. 3 below; bk. ii begins fol. 10ra.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: De dialectica

rubric.add: Dyalogus regis karoli et albini magistri eius de predicamentis

msItem.incipit: Quia mentionem philosophię
msItem.note: Ch. 3 begins fol. 27vb. Breaks off unfinished in c. 8 (PL 101.962C). Rest of fol. 28vc blank except for rubric for art. 5 at bottom.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In Isagogen Porphyrii Commentorum editio secunda
msItem.rubric: Anicii Manlii Severini Boetii in Porphyrii Ysagogas a se translatas editionis secunde liber I incipit
msItem.incipit: Secundus his arreptę expositionis labor

msItem.note: Fols. 27vb-28vc, see art. 3 above.

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: Categoriae
msItem.note: (tr. Boethius)
msItem.incipit: AEQUIUOCA DICVNTVR quorum nomen solum commune est secundum nomen vero substantię ratio diuersa
msItem.note: Fol. 32vb-c blank.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In Categorias Aristotelis
msItem.rubric: Anicii Manlii Severini Boetii editionis primę in Aristotelis Cathegorias a se translatas incipit liber primvs
msItem.incipit: Expeditis hiis quę ad predicamenta

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: De interpretatione
msItem.note: (tr. Boethius)
msItem.incipit: Primum oportet constituere

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In librum Aristotelis Perihermenias commentarii editio prima
msItem.rubric: Anicii M. S. Boetii In πηριηρμηνιας editionis .i. liber .i. incipit
msItem.incipit: Magna quidem libri huius apud peripatheticam sectam probatur auctorias

title.supplied: Accessus: on the name and title of Boethius and the definition of philosophy

msItem.incipit: Anicius ut quidam putant ab anno dictus, eo quod optabant parentes eius eum annosum fieri
(fol. 76va) Philosophia est amor sapientię et inquisitio uel cognitio diuinarium humanarumque rerum. Aliter, philosophia est honestas uitę, studium bene uiuendi
msItem.explicit: Aethica socrates primus ad componendos mores instituit Logicam que rationalis uocatur plato sub iunxit diuidens in dialecticam et rethoricam
msItem.note: Follows without a break from the preceding item. Rest of fol. 76va blank.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In librum Aristotelis Perihermenias commentarii editio secunda

rubric.add: Incipit secunda edicio boecij super librum peryermenias aristotelis

msItem.incipit: Alexander in commentariis suis
msItem.explicit: illas quidem quas cathegoricas greci nominant
msItem.note: Ends presumably imperfect at PL 64.487D.
Fol. 97r blank.

msItem.author: Cicero
msItem.title: Topica

rubric.add: Textus Marci Tullij ad trebecium iuris consultum

msItem.incipit: MAIORES NOS RES SRIBERE ingressos

finalRubric.add: Explicit liber topicorum Marci tulii ad trebatium

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: In Ciceronis Topica commentum

rubric.add: Commentum subsequens est antecedentis immediate libri a Boetio editum

msItem.incipit: Exhortatione mi patri cum rethoricum
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 128rc blank; fol. 128v blank.

msItem.incipit: (fol. 137va) Sępe et multum hoc mecum cogitaui

msItem.rubric: Corax siracusanus Rethoricam apud romanos primus inuenit, Tisias diuulgauit
msItem.incipit: Partes rethorices sunt .v. Inuentio, disposito, elocutio, memoria, pronunciatio. Inuentio est excogiatio rerum uerarum et uerisimilium que causam probabilem reddant
msItem.explicit: Tertium demonstratiuum dicitur cuius finis est honestas et turpitudo, cuius auditor demonstator uel laudator dicitur
msItem.note: Contemporary addition.

msItem.incipit: (fol. 137va, margin) Primum in hoc libro notandum quod quicumque incipit orationem tria adhibere debet
msItem.note: Marginal and interlinear gloss and commentary, deriving in large part from Victorinus (see the following item); see Mary Dickey, ‘Some Commentaries on the De Inventione and Ad Herennium of the Eleventh and Twelfth Centuries’, Mediaeval and Renaissance Studies, 6 (1968), 1–41 (2, 8–9): 'the Laudian gloss', written probably in southern Germany or northern Italy, after 996 (on the date see also Colin Morris in Journal of Theological Studies 20/2 (1969), 671).
Misbound: the correct order is 137–144, 129–136, 145–146. Fol. 137r blank.

msItem.incipit: OMNIS QUVICVQUE incipit cuiuscumque generis orationem hec tria in principus adhibere debet
msItem.note: Followed without a break by:

msItem.incipit: Cum sint .xi. attributa personis quibus approbatur persona
msItem.note: Frequently transmitted with Victorinus; here breaks off unfinished. K. Halm, Rhetores Latini minores (1863) 305–306.10
Top left corner: Ovid, Ex ponto, iii.13–14. Bottom: grammatical note (?) (beg. 'Per genus et differentiam fit diffinitio uera').
Contemporary and later marginal and interlinear glosses and notes, especially in arts. 1–2, 6, 13 (for which see above).

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule by several hands ('at least eight' according to Hoffmann).

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for initials, not filled in, fols. 76v, 96v, etc.
'Puzzle' initials in red and blue with penwork flourishing in both colours added, late thirteenth or fourteenth century, fols. 119r, 129r, 147v.

history.origin:
11th century (first quarter?); added decoration c. 1300
German, Mainz (?)
history.provenance: The script and original decoration were attributed to Mainz by H. Hoffmann, Buchkunst und Königtum im ottonischen und frühsalischen Reich (1986), I.253, who compared the script of Basel, UB, L III 3 and N 1 2 and (p. 246) of Marburg, UB, MS. 375/32.

msItem.author: John of Hildesheim
msItem.title: Speculum fontis uitae
msItem.note: Fol. 167r blank except for theological notes added in the bottom left corner: 'Omnium quomodolibet illuminatorum est unicus tantum '
Fol. 167v, capitula; added in the upper right margin is a reference to bk. 3 of the Fons vite of 'Auicebromphus' (Ibn Gabirol)
msItem.rubric:
(fol. 167v) Stet speculum vita fontis precor omnibus annis quod carmelite finxit pia musa iohannis hildensheimensis necis a quo sit procul ensis.
Alma parens vite pons deduscissima vita
Fac mea me vite pia dignificare loqui te
(fol. 168r) Incipit speculum fontis vite fratris iohannis de hildenshiem ordinis beate marie de monte karmeli. Capitulum primum de viui fontis intrinseca secunda perfeccione
msItem.incipit: Unicum est omne penitus ens transcendens intellectuale fontale non mensum viuum
msItem.note: Blank spaces (intended for decoration?) on fol. 173r-v.
msItem.bibl: The unique copy: see Verfasserlexikon IV.639-40.

msItem.title: Prayer to Jesus
msItem.incipit: Domine iesu christe qui singulari dileccione a beata martha virgine et hospitea tua corporaliter sepius hospitari refici et tibi ministrari elegisti
msItem.note: Contemporary addition. Followed by two lines in red:

msItem.incipit: O pharisee ideo parum diligis quia parum tibi dimitti suspicaris

msItem.note: Fol. 176v blank; fol. 177r-v blank.

layoutDesc.layout: 1 col., 27 lines; ruled in leadpoint. Area of the ruled space for the main text, 190 115–20

handDesc.handNote: Main text, textualis formata by one hand.

revisionDesc.change: New draft description for Polonsky German.
